1 """
2 Unittest for the maze_solve package
3 
4 Inputs
5  Solver - calls the Solver class in the maze_solve package

8 import rospy
9 import unittest
10 from maze_solve import Solver
11 import numpy as np
12 
13 class MazeTest(unittest.TestCase):
14  def small_maze_test(self):
15  """ Tests if the maze_solver solves this maze and returns the x and y indices
16  as a list
17  """
18  maze = np.array([[0,0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0],
19  [0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0],
20  [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0],
21  [0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0],
22  [0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0],
23  [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0],
24  [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
25  ])
26  solver = Solver(maze)
27  start = np.array([1, 1])
28  end = np.array([5,6])
29 
30  (x_path, y_path) = solver.solve_maze(start, end)
31  print(x_path)
32  print(y_path)
33  self.assertEquals(x_path,[1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4])
34  self.assertEquals(y_path,[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 5])
35 
36 
37 if __name__ == "__main__":
38  import rosunit
39  rosunit.unitrun('balance_board', 'MazeTest', MazeTest)
